titleInfo.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to eliminate the lower threshold for the refundable portion of the child tax credit, and for other purposes.

extension.shortTitle: Child Tax Credit Permanency Act of 2015
extension.officialTitle: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to eliminate the lower threshold for the refundable portion of the child tax credit, and for other purposes.
extension.action: Ms. DeLauro (for herself, Mr. Levin, Mr. Neal, Mr. Doggett, Mrs. Beatty, Mr. Becerra, Mr. Beyer, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, Mr. Blumenauer, Ms. Bonamici, Ms. Brown of Florida, Ms. Brownley of California, Mrs. Bustos, Mr. Butterfield, Mrs. Capps, Mr. Capuano, Mr. Cárdenas, Mr. Carson of Indiana, Mr. Cartwright, Ms. Chu of California, Mr. Cicilline, Ms. Clark of Massachusetts, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Clay, Mr. Cleaver, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Connolly, Mr. Conyers, Mr. Courtney, Mr. Crowley, Mr. Cummings, Mr. Danny K.
